meanings.definition: The quality or state of being soluble.
meanings.sent1: The solvabilities of sugar in water make it easy to sweeten drinks.
meanings.sent2: The scientist tested the solvabilities of different salts in various liquids.
meanings.sent3: The solvabilities of the puzzle pieces in the toddler's mouth led to a sticky situation.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a solvabilities that could mend even the toughest of hearts.
meanings.sent5: The solvabilities of the glue were so strong that the pieces stayed together forever.

meanings.definition: The ability of a substance to be dissolved in a solvent.
meanings.sent1: The solvabilities of salt in water were demonstrated in the science experiment.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the solvabilities of different materials is crucial in chemistry.
meanings.sent3: The solvabilities of the chocolate in the warm milk created a delicious treat.
meanings.sent4: His charm had a solvabilities that melted away her worries.
meanings.sent5: The solvabilities of the ink in the water created a beautiful swirling pattern.
